intro: Satureja brachiata, commonly known as mountain savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink or purple. Its leaves are aromatic, with a scent reminiscent of thyme and oregano, making it a valued herb in traditional medicine and cuisine. Satureja brachiata thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments.
